body.p:
Dear Sir I take the liberty of wrighting to you in behalf of C. HanCock I was presant at the fite between him and Edens when the quarrel Commenst HandCo went from Edens some thirty yards Edens went whear HandCock was the fight comenced & handCock did not gouge out Edens Eye but from the gouge fever fell in his eye and it went Out of Sam Edens and he said it was so I Also saw HandCock pay him $114 00 the damag I drew up and agreement between them They both wear Drunk at the time of the fight I would further state HandCock is a poore mand & has lost his wife
and has a family of Small Children to rais upp his Exelancy Governor Bramlet could Consider do any thing in his behalf it would be thankfully received he has All reddy paid Cost & Damage as much as he Can bare and support his helpless family
My Respects to you no news all well matters as when you left let me here from you yours Respctfully

Hon J. J. Gatewood Esqr
House Representatives
